casebody.data:
Louis POLL, v. HAMILTON MANUFACTURING COMPANY, a Michigan Corporation. No. 7929. Circuit Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. Oct. 10, 1939. Rice & Rice, of Grand Rapids, Mich., and Orien S. Cross, of Holland, Mich., for appellant. Harry Pell, of Allegan, Mich., for appellee.

Before HICKS and SIMONS, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

It is ordered that the appeal herein he and the same is dismissed, pursuant to stipulation of counsel.
